incidents.name: Voice Intelligence May Be Experiencing Delays Processing Their Transcriptions When Using Sentiment Analysis or Summarisation Features

incident_updates.body: All requests have now been reprocessed, and Voice Intelligence is operating normally at this time. This incident is resolved.

New Voice Intelligence requests that utilise Summarisation and Sentiment features are now being successfully processed.
Engineering team are working to redrive requests that could not be processed earlier. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customer using the Sentiment Analysis or Summarisation features of Voice Intelligence may be experiencing delays processing their transcriptions. Our engineers our working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available

incidents.name: Super SIM Network Connectivity Issues

incident_updates.body: Network connectivity issues with Super SIM has been resolved and Super SIM is operating normally at this time.

We have observed that the recent impact was limited to devices connected over AT&T. Currently, we are still monitoring the situation as approximately 5% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. In the meantime, we kindly suggest that customers reset the connectivity through the console or through the APIs (by reactivating SIMs) if they notice that some of their SIM cards are still experiencing issues. This can often help re-establish a stable connection for the affected devices. We will provide another update in 4 hours or sooner as soon as we have more information available.

We have observed that the recent impact was limited to devices connected over AT&T. Currently, we are still monitoring the situation as approximately 5% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. In the meantime, we kindly suggest that customers reset the connectivity through the console or through the APIs (by reactivating SIMs) if they notice that some of their SIM cards are still experiencing issues. This can often help re-establish a stable connection for the affected devices. We will provide another update in 4 hours or sooner as soon as we have more information available.

Beginning at 5:20 AM UTC, we observed about 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. We are continuing to work on identifying and resolving the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

Beginning at 5:20 AM UTC, we observed about 10% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. We are actively working to identify and resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Some New UK Customers Are Unable to Provision Phone Numbers to Their Trial Account Using the “Get Phone Number” Button via the SMS Onboarding Tutorial

incident_updates.body: Provisioning a phone number to new trial account by using “Get phone number” button via the SMS onboarding tutorial is now operating normally. This issue has been resolved.

Provisioning a phone number to new trial account by using “Get phone number” button via the SMS onboarding tutorial is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We’ll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified the issue affecting some new UK customers that are running into an error when trying to provision a phone number to their new trial account by using the button “Get phone number” via the SMS onboarding tutorial. The current workaround is to use the “Buy a Number” page in the Twilio Console. Our Engineers are continuing to work on a permanent fix. We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Increased Latency and 500 HTTP Errors on Verify API

incident_updates.body: Twilio was degraded between May 27th between 16:17:22 and 16:17:54 UTC. During this period of time customers may have experienced increased latency and 500 HTTP errors on Verify API. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on 1% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: Connectivity dropped on 1% of Super SIM devices has been resolved and Super SIM is operating normally at this time.
Connectivity for Super SIM is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still investigating the issues with connectivity dropped on 1% of Super SIM devices. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. We will provide another update in 4 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

Beginning at 20:50 UTC we observed 1% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
